intro: Sieglingia, commonly known as the false dandelion, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and inconspicuous flowers that are often overlooked. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Sieglingia species are often found in temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. Its botanical features make it a valuable subject for ecological and horticultural study.
